block.comment:
This is an example System-of-Systems (SoS) block named "example_block", on the work-space.
You may: 1. Drag the block/work-space with the mouse. 2. Minimize / Maximize / Partially minimize a block by double clicking on it. 3. Drag and drop new blocks from the Toolbox from *left* hand side. 4. Add related blocks to this block by clicking (+) drop-down below. 5. Right click on the block/work-space to see a menu. 6. Close this *comment* by clicking on the (?) button.

block.field: Running Distance between 7 cm and 9 cm

block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. SoS : Kilobot platooning
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Dependability guarantee : Starting Position = Straight line 2. Dependability guarantee : Starting distance = 5 cm
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Dependability guarantee : Running distance = 5 cm

block.field: The leader is decided before execution
block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. State variable : leader_uid
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. State variable : leader_uid
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. RUMI : Message Exchange
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. RUMI : Kilobot program load
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. RUPI : Calculate Distance
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. RUMI : Message Exchange
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Message : Leader Notify

block.field: Any kilobot can enter the platoon
Only last kilobot can leave the platoon

block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Expected and beneficial behaviour : Unique Platoon
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. State variable : kilo_ticks
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. RUMI : Message Exchange
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Dependability guarantee : Motors spinup duration = 1000 ms

block.field: Platooning runs for a limited duration

block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. SoS : Kilobot platooning

block.field: Starting Position: Straight Line - Distance: 8 cm
block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Dependability guarantee : Starting Position = Straight line 2. Dependability guarantee : Starting distance = 5 cm
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Dependability guarantee : Running distance = 5 cm

block.field: The leader is the kilobot with id 0
block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. State variable : leader_uid

block.field: All kilobots know the leader is the one with id 0
block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. State variable : leader_uid

block.field: Kilobot RUMI connects kilobots and controller
block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. RUMI : Message Exchange

block.field: Controller RUMI connects controller to kilobots
block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. RUMI : Kilobot program load

block.field: RUPI kilobot is used to calculate distance among kilobots
block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. RUPI : Calculate Distance

block.field: kbot-kbot RUMI used for sending direction messages
block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. RUMI : Message Exchange
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Message : Leader Notify 2. Execute : null

block.field: RUPI uses signal strength to calculate distance
When a LEFT message is received, the receiver forwards the message to its follower and turn left for 126 kilo-ticks
block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Execute : null 2. Execute : null

block.field: When a STRAIGHT message is received, the receiver forwards the message to its follower and goes straight for 700 kilo-ticks
block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Execute : null 2. Execute : null

block.field: When the last kilobot wants to leave the platoon, it sends a LEAVE message to everyone
block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Execute : null 2. Execute : null

block.field: When a kilobot wants to join the platoon, it sends a JOIN message to the last kilobot in the platoon
block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Execute : null 2. Execute : null

block.field: When a JOIN message is received, the receiver send an OK message iff it's not turning
When an OK message is received, it waits for 150 kilo-ticks and then it starts following the platoon
Any kilobot can enter the platoon if it was not platooning before
Kilobots can join the platoon only at its tail
Only last kilobot can leave the platoon

block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Expected and beneficial behaviour : Unique Platoon

block.field: Kilobots clock is based on kilo-ticks (32 kilo-ticks = 1 second)
block.requirement: Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. State variable : kilo_ticks
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. RUMI : Message Exchange
Satisfied by block(s) : -------------------------------- 1. Dependability guarantee : Motors spinup duration = 1000 ms
